author: TheSeer

text:
Two down, plenty left to go.  The question is, when Supra puts in another Transistor song, will it be The Spine, Impossible or Paper Boats?

Personally, I listed my preferences in order.  I fell in love with The Spine when I first heard it while Impossible is a great "Final Boss" theme.  As for Paper Boats, well... that would be going into spoiler territory, wouldn't it?
author: mas8705

text: +mas8705 I think it'll be Vanishing Point.
author: Alucard65535

text: I tried playing this game after a months-long time gap of not playing it, and this is why deleting save files is bliss. I had a sort of similar problem with Apotheon, except that it was a glitch that prevented you from progressing if you saved once you ascended, after beating the first boss.
author: j

text: I finished this game yesterday. I thought the game was as good as Bastion, which is to say that I liked it but nowhere near as much as the general opinion I've seen on it. The graphics are top notch, the soundtrack is great and the unique setting gets you immersed in it. I found the core gameplay very satisfying once you understand it, but once I felt like I had a lot of tools and started to master different strategies, the game was over. Just like with Bastion, I feel like they developed a great gameplay system but it's never fully realised and fleshed out, hindered in part by the low enemy variety. The story is another aspect I was once again not a big fan of, being told in a way that feels more convoluted than it should be. I respect Greg Kasavin very much, especially when he was a game reviewer, but I just can't seem to connect with his writing in the games he works on. This all seems quite negative, but in the end I did enjoy the ~5 hours I put on it.
author: SupraDarky

text: +SupraDarky exactly my thoughts on bastion i want to try this game out soon but im saddened that they didnt fix this weakness of theirs
author: Chien

text: +SupraDarky I recommend trying NG+. The enemies ramp up considerably in difficulty, so you have to put these advanced strategies into place - it makes the gameplay a lot more engaging. Of course, that should have been the case for the first playthrough, but I think you'd get along with NG+.
author: JayMoyles

text: +JayMoyles I also recommend the NG+ option, but to better appreciate the story (and the soundtrack :)) rather than for the gameplay itself. Anyway I share exactly the same feelings as Supra does on this game: solid game, technically and artistically brilliant, yet it falls short in gameplay and the unsual way the story is told.
author: Carlos Pozo
